VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
Optimist House was not required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns based on the review of Whaley Children's Center -
Optimist House budget and financial audit dated December 31, 2021 and 2020.
PREA compliance
Not applicable.
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief Administrator Assessment report dated April 6, 2023, was reviewed. Chief
administrator and Whaley Children’s Center leadership team found compliance with
licensing rules and contract expectations. Optimist House utilizes trauma informed
care practices. Optimist House partnered with Crim Foundation, which provides
Mindfulness training and activities. Optimist House implemented the requirements
for Qualified Residential Treatment Program and is accredited through CARF.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff were interviewed on April 12, 2023, and April 20, 2023. Staff did not report
any concerns or training needs.
Youths were interviewed on April 20, 2023. Youths explained the expectations of
the program. Youth stated feeling safe and did not share any program concerns.
Description of Agency Walk Through
A walk through of Optimist House occurred on April 20, 2023. New laminate
flooring was installed in the kitchen, dining area and main living room. There are no
issues or safety concerns noted.
3

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
